body:
> A) don't use pointers to interfacesâ€¦ it's pretty much redundant, and almost certainly not what you want to do.

That may be, but they're still part of Go 1 and they do have valid uses.

> B) your code panics even if you attempt: _ = u.(U1) instead.

That's because `u` is the nil interface value, which always causes the type assertion to fail.  See [Type assertions](https://golang.org/ref/spec#Type_assertions) [emphasis added]:

> For an expression `x` of interface type and a type `T`, the primary expression
>
>     x.(T)
>
> asserts **that `x` is not `nil`** and that the value stored in `x` is of type `T`.
